/ noun, adj., adv., verb

b part of body

behind sb’s ˈback k without sb’s knowledge or permission  không cho ai biết; không được (ai) cho phép:

break the ˈback of sth to finish the largest or most important part of a task  hoàn thành phần lớn hoặc phần quan trọng nhất của công việc
get/put sb’s ˈback up ( informal) to annoy sb 
làm phiền, gây phiền hà:

get off sb’s ˈback ( informal) to stop annoying sb, for example by criticizing them, or asking them to do sth  không làm phiền người khác nữa (không chỉ trích/đòi hỏi):

bảo vệ và ủng hộ; chống lưng:

have your ˌback to the ˈwall ( informal) to be in a difficult situation in which you are forced to do sth but are unable to make the choices that you would like  bị bắt buộc nhưng bất lực
off the ˌback of a ˈlorry ( BrE, informal, humorous) goods that fell off the back of a lorry were probably stolen. People say or accept that they came ‘ off the back of a lorry’ to avoid saying or asking where they really came from.  không rõ xuất xứ
on the back of sth as a result of an achievement or a success 
có kết quả, đạt được:

(flat) on your back ( informal) in bed because you are ill/sick 
nằm bẹp, nằm liệt giường (vì ốm):

1 k to move so that you are standing or sitting with your back facing sb/sth 

2 k to reject sb/sth that you have previously been connected with  quay lưng lại với ai/điều gì (nghĩa bóng):

ˌback ˈdown (on/from sth)
( NAmE also
ˌback ˈoff) to take back a demand, an opinion, etc. that other people are strongly opposed to; to admit defeat 
rút lại (yêu cầu, ý kiến, vv. bị phản đối dữ dội); chịu thua cuộc:

ˌback ˈoff
1 to move backwards in order to get away from sb/sth frightening or unpleasant 
lùi lại (khỏi ai hoặc cái gì đáng sợ/khó chịu):
As the riot police approached, the crowd backed off.
2 to stop threatening, criticizing or annoying sb  ngừng đe doạ/chỉ trích/làm phiền:
Back off! There’s no need to yell at me. ◇ The press have agreed to back off and leave the couple alone.
ˌback ˈoff (from sth) to choose not to take action, in order to avoid a difficult situation 
rút lui (trước tình huống khó khăn):

ˌback ˈonto sth ( BrE) ( of a building) to have sth directly behind it  có thứ gì ngay đằng sau:

ˌback ˈout (of sth) to decide that you are no longer going to take part in sth that has been agreed  rút lui (khỏi điều đã thoả thuận):
He lost confidence and backed out of the deal at the last minute.
ˌback ˈup | ˌback sth↔ˈup to move backwards, especially in a vehicle 
lùi xe lại:

2 k to provide support for sb/sth 
cung cấp hỗ trợ:
two doctors backed up by a team of nurses ◇ The rebels backed up their demands with threats.

1 k linking verb there is/are + noun to exist; to be present 

] + adv./prep. to be located; to be in a place 

] + adv./prep. to happen at a time or in a place 

I
] (only used in the perfect tenses  chỉ dùng với thì hoàn thành ) + adv./prep. to visit or call 

Tiếng Anh Bắc Mỹ dùng từ come với nghĩa này: Has the mailman come yet?

I
] ~ from… used to say where sb was born or where their home is 
đến từ, xuất thân từ, quê quán ở:

8 k linking verb used when you are naming people or things, describing them or giving more information about them  dùng để gọi tên, miêu tả, cung cấp thông tin về người/vật; là:
+ noun Today is Monday. ◇ ‘Who is that?’ ‘It’s my brother.’ ◇ She’s a great beauty. ◇ Susan is a doctor. ◇ He wants to be (= become) a pilot when he grows up. ◇ + adj. It’s beautiful! ◇ Life is unfair. ◇ He is ten years old. ◇ ‘How are you?’ ‘I’m very well, thanks.’ ◇ Be quick! ◇ ~ (that)… The fact is (that) we don’t have enough money. ◇ ~ doing sth The problem is getting it all done in the time available. ◇ ~ to do sth The problem is to get it all done in the time available.
9 k linking verb it is/was used when you are describing a situation or saying what you think about it  dùng để miêu tả, nêu ý kiến về một tình huống:
+ adj. It was really hot in the sauna. ◇ It’s strange how she never comes to see us any more. ◇ He thinks it’s clever to make fun of people. ◇ + noun It would be a shame if you lost it. ◇ It’s going to be a great match.
10 k linking verb it is/was used to talk about time  dùng để chỉ thời gian:
+ noun It’s two thirty. ◇ + adj. It was late at night when we finally arrived.
11 k linking verb + noun used to say what sth is made of  dùng để nói “làm bằng gì”:
Is your jacket real leather?
12 k linking verb [
I
] used to say who sth belongs to or who it is intended for  dùng để nói “của ai”:
~ mine, yours, etc. The money’s not yours, it’s John’s. ◇ ~ for me, you, etc. This package is for you.
13 k linking verb + noun to cost 
có giá:
‘How much is that dress?’ ‘Eighty dollars.’
14 k linking verb + noun to be equal to 
bằng:
Three and three is six. ◇ How much is a thousand pounds in euros? ◇ Let x be the sum of a and b. ◇ London is not England (= do not think that all of England is like London).
15 k linking verb ~ everything, nothing, etc. (to sb) used to say how important sth is to sb  dùng để chỉ tầm quan trọng của một vật với một người:
Money isn’t everything (= it is not the only important thing). ◇ A thousand dollars is nothing to somebody as rich as he is.
i
Các thành ngữ có từ be được giải thích ở các mục từ của danh từ và tính từ thuộc thành ngữ đó, ví dụ be the death of sb nằm ở mục từ death.
the ˌbe-all and ˈend-all (of sth) ( informal) the most important part; all that matters 
điều quan trọng nhất:
Her career is the be-all and end-all of her existence.
as/that was as sb/sth used to be called  vốn được gọi như thế:
Jill Davis that was (= before her marriage) ◇ the Soviet Union, as was
(he, she, etc. has) been and ˈdone sth ( BrE, informal) used to show that you are surprised and annoyed by sth that sb has done  thể hiện sự ngạc nhiên/khó chịu với điều người khác đã làm:
Someone’s been and parked in front of the entrance!
asee also go and do sth
if it wasn’t/weren’t for… k used to say that sb/sth stopped sb/sth from happening 
nếu không có:
If it weren’t for you, I wouldn’t be alive today.
ˌleave/ˌlet sb/sth ˈbe to leave sb/sth alone without disturbing them or it 
để yên (để cho được yên ổn):
Leave her be, she obviously doesn’t want to talk about it. ◇ Let the poor dog be (= don’t annoy it).
-to-be ( in compounds  trong từ ghép ) future 
(trong) tương lai; sẽ là:
his bride-to-be ◇ mothers-to-be (= pregnant women)
_S auxiliary verb
1 k used with a past participle to form the passive  kết hợp với phân từ quá khứ để hình thành thể bị động; bị, được:
He was killed in the war. ◇ Where were they made? ◇ The house was still being built. ◇ You will be told what to do.
2 k used with a present participle to form progressive tenses  kết hợp với phân từ hiện tại để hình thành thì tiếp diễn; đang:
I am studying Chinese. ◇ I’ll be seeing him soon. ◇ What have you been doing this week? ◇ I’m always being criticized.
3 k used to make question tags (= short questions added to the end of statements)  để hình thành câu hỏi đuôi:
You’re not hungry, are you? ◇ Ben’s coming, isn’t he? ◇ The old theatre was pulled down, wasn’t it?
4 k used to avoid repeating the full form of a verb in the passive or a progressive tense  dùng thay cho động từ trước đó ở thể bị động hoặc thì tiếp diễn:
Karen wasn’t beaten in any of her games, but all the others were. ◇ ‘Are you coming with us?’ ‘No, I’m not.’
5 k ~ to do sth used to say what must or should be done 
phải, nên:
I am to call them once I reach the airport. ◇ You are to report this to the police. ◇ What is to be done about this problem?
6 k ~ to do sth used to say what is arranged to happen  chỉ điều được dự tính sẽ xảy ra; sẽ phải:
They are to be married in June.
7 ~ to do sth used to say what happened later 
sẽ:
He was to regret that decision for the rest of his life (= he did regret it).
8 ~ not, never, etc. to be done used to say what could not or did not happen 
không thể; không:
Anna was nowhere to be found (= we could not find her anywhere). ◇ He was never to see his wife again (= although he did not know it would be so at the time, he did not see her again). ◇ She wanted to write a successful novel, but it was not to be (= it turned out never to happen).
9 if sb/it were to do sth… | were sb/it to do sth… ( formal) used to express a condition 
nếu:
If we were to offer you more money, would you stay? ◇ Were we to offer you more money, would you stay?

bɪ‑
/ prefix

before k /
bɪˈfɔː(r)
/ prep., conj., adv.
_S prep.
1 k earlier than sb/sth 

trước (theo thứ tự):

4 k used to say that sth is facing sb in the future  dùng để chỉ điều sẽ đối mặt trong tương lai; trước, trước mặt:

5 in the presence of sb who is listening, watching, etc  khi có người khác đang nghe, nhìn, vv.; trước, trước mặt:

6 ( formal) used to say how sb reacts when they have to face sb/sth  dùng để chỉ cách phản ứng khi đối mặt với ai/cái gì; trước:

cho đến khi:

kẻo:

4 ( formal) rather than 
thà ... còn hơn; thà ... chứ không:
I’d die before I apologized!

trước, trước đây:

1 to make sb want to ask a question that has not yet been answered khiến người nào muốn nêu câu hỏi chưa được trả lời: All of which begs the question as to who will fund the project.
2 to talk about sth as if it were definitely true, even though it might not be cứ cho là: These assumptions beg the question that children learn languages more easily than adults.

1 ( formal) used to tell sb that you are sorry for sth you have said or done (tôi) xin lỗi: I beg your pardon, I thought that was my coat.
2 used to ask sb to repeat what they have just said because you did not hear xin lỗi (tôi chưa nghe rõ): ‘It’s on Duke Street.’ ‘I beg your pardon.’ ‘Duke Street.’
3 ( especially BrE) used to tell sb that you are offended by what they have just said or by the way that they have said it xin lỗi nhé (mỉa): ‘Just go away.’ ‘I beg your pardon!’

_S prep.

best
best k /
best
/ adj., adv., noun, verb
_S adj. (superlative of good )
1 k of the most excellent type or quality 
tốt nhất; xuất sắc nhất:
That’s the best movie I’ve ever seen! ◇ She was one of the best tennis players of her generation. ◇ Is that your best suit? ◇ They’ve been best friends (= closest friends) since they were children. ◇ the company’s best-ever results ◇ We want the kids to have the best possible education.
2 k most enjoyable; happiest 
sướng nhất:
Those were the best years of my life.
3 k most suitable or appropriate 
thích hợp nhất:
What’s the best way to cook steak? ◇ The best thing to do would be to apologize. ◇ He’s the best man for the job. ◇ It’s best if you go now. ◇ I’m not in the best position to advise you.
i
Các thành ngữ có từ best (tính từ) được giải thích ở các mục từ của danh từ và động từ thuộc thành ngữ đó, ví dụ on your best behaviour nằm ở mục từ behaviour.
_S adv. (superlative of well, often used in adjectives  dạng so sánh nhất của từ well thường dùng trong tính từ )
1 k most; to the greatest extent 
nhiều nhất; lớn nhất:
Which one do you like best? ◇ Well-drained soil suits the plant best. ◇ her best-known poem
2 k in the most excellent way; to the highest standard 
xuất sắc nhất; tốt nhất:
He works best in the mornings. ◇ Britain’s best-dressed woman ◇ The beaches are beautiful, but, best of all, there are very few tourists.
3 k in the most suitable or appropriate way 
thích hợp/phù hợp nhất:
Painting is best done in daylight. ◇ Do as you think best (= what you think is the most suitable thing to do).
i
as ˌbest you ˈcan not perfectly but as well as you are able 
tốt nhất có thể:
We’ll manage as best we can.
_S noun k [
sing. ] ( usually the best)
1 k the most excellent thing or person 
điều/người tốt nhất:
We all want the best for our children. ◇ They only buy the best. ◇ They’re all good players, but she’s the best of all. ◇ We’re the best of friends (= very close friends).
2 k the highest standard that sb/sth can reach 
tiêu chuẩn/chuẩn mực cao nhất:
She always brings out the best in people. ◇ The town looks its best (= is most attractive) in the spring. ◇ Don’t worry about the exam—just do your best. ◇ The roses are past their best now. ◇ I don’t really feel at my best today.
3 k something that is as close as possible to what you need or want  điều gần nhất với điều bạn mong muốn xảy ra:
Fifty pounds is the best I can offer you. ◇ The best we can hope for in the game is a draw.
4 the highest standard that a particular person has reached, especially in a sport 
thành tích tốt nhất (trong thể thao):
She won the race with a personal best of 2 minutes 22.
i
all the ˈbest ( informal) used when you are saying goodbye to sb or ending a letter, to give sb your good wishes  dùng để chào tạm biệt hoặc kết thúc bức thư, gởi đến ai những lời chúc tốt đẹp
at ˈbest used for saying what is the best opinion you can have of sb/sth, or the best thing that can happen, when the situation is bad 
điều tốt nhất có thể (trong tình huống xấu):
Their response to the proposal was, at best, cool. ◇ We can’t arrive before Friday at best.
be (all) for the ˈbest used to say that although sth appears bad or unpleasant now, it will be good in the end  dù đang có vẻ không tốt/không hay, nhưng cuối cùng rồi cũng sẽ tốt đẹp:
I don’t want you to leave, but perhaps it’s for the best.
the best of a bad ˈbunch
( BrE also
the best of a bad ˈlot) ( informal) a person or thing that is a little better than the rest of a group, although none are very good  xứ mù thằng chột làm vua
the best of ˈthree, ˈfive, etc. ( especially in games and sports  nhất là trong trò chơi và thể thao ) up to three, five, etc. games played to decide who wins, the winner being the person who wins most of them  chơi khoảng ba đến năm trận để tìm ra người thắng nhiều trận nhất
the best that money can ˈbuy the very best 
điều tốt nhất:
We make sure our clients get the best that money can buy.
do, mean, etc. sth for the ˈbest to do or say sth in order to achieve a good result or to help sb  làm/nói điều gì để đạt được kết quả tốt hoặc để giúp ai:
I just don’t know what to do for the best. ◇ I’m sorry if my advice offended you—I meant it for the best.
have/get the ˈbest of sth to gain more advantage from sth than sb else 
có nhiều lợi thế hơn:
I thought you had the best of that discussion.
make the best of sth/it | make the best of things | make the best of a bad job to accept a bad or difficult situation and do as well as you can  chấp nhận tình huống xấu/khó khăn và làm hết sức mình
to the best of your ˈknowledge/beˈlief as far as you know 
theo chỗ (tôi/bạn) biết:
He never made a will, to the best of my knowledge.
with the ˈbest (of them) as well as anyone 
như ai:
He’ll be out there, dancing with the best of them.

bet k /
bet
/ verb, noun
_S verb (
bet•ting, bet, bet
)
1 k [
I ,
T
] to risk money on a race or an event by trying to predict the result 
đánh cá, đánh cược:
You have to be over 16 to bet. ◇ ~ on/against sth I wouldn’t bet on them winning the next election. ◇ ~ sth (on sth) He bet $2 000 on the final score of the game. ◇ ~ (sb) (sth) (that…) She bet me £20 that I wouldn’t do it.
asee also betting ,
gamble
2 k [
T
] ( informal) used to say that you are almost certain that sth is true or that sth will happen  đánh cá, đánh cược (cam đoan điều gì đúng hoặc sẽ xảy ra):
~ (that)… I bet (that) we’re too late. ◇ You can bet (that) the moment I sit down, the phone will ring. ◇ ~ sb (that)… I’ll bet you (that) he knows all about it.
i
I/I’ll bet! ( informal)
1 used to show that you can understand what sb is feeling, describing, etc.  tôi hiểu chứ!:
‘I nearly died when he told me.’ ‘I bet!’
2 used to tell sb that you do not believe what they have just said  thế cơ à!:
‘I’m going to tell her what I think of her.’ ‘Yeah, I bet!’
I wouldn’t ˈbet on it | don’t ˈbet on it ( informal) used to say that you do not think that sth is very likely  tôi không tin:
‘She’ll soon get used to the idea.’ ‘I wouldn’t bet on it.’
ˌyou ˈbet! ( informal) used instead of ‘yes’ to emphasize that sb has guessed sth correctly or made a good suggestion  đúng thế!, chắc chắn!, tất nhiên!:
‘Are you nervous?’ ‘You bet!’
you can bet your ˈlife/your bottom ˈdollar (on sth/(that)…) ( informal) used to say that you are certain that sth will happen 
cam đoan, chắc chắn:
You can bet your bottom dollar that he’ll be late.
_S noun
1 k an arrangement to risk money, etc. on the result of a particular event; the money that you risk in this way 
sự đánh cược; tiền cược:
to win/lose a bet ◇ ~ on sth We’ve got a bet on who’s going to arrive first. ◇ He had a bet on the horses. ◇ They all put a bet on the race. ◇ I hear you’re taking bets on whether she’ll marry him. ◇ I did it for a bet (= because sb had agreed to pay me money if I did). ◇ ‘Liverpool are bound to win.’ ‘Do you want a bet? ’ (= I disagree with you, I don’t think they will.)
2 ( informal) an opinion about what is likely to happen or to have happened 
ý nghĩ (về điều có thể/đã xảy ra):
My bet is that they’ve been held up in traffic.
i
all bets are ˈoff used to say that if a particular event happens then your current forecast, agreement, etc. will no longer apply  nếu thế thì không còn gì nữa:
We expect shares to rise unless the economy slows down again, in which case all bets are off.
the/your best bet ( informal) used to tell sb what is the best action for them to take to get the result they want  nói với ai hành động nào là tốt nhất để có được kết quả như mong muốn; cái tốt nhất:
If you want to get around London fast, the Underground is your best bet.
a ˌgood/ˌsafe ˈbet something that is likely to happen, to succeed or to be suitable  chuyện có thể xảy ra/thành công/thích hợp; cái tốt nhất:
Clothes are a safe bet as a present for a teenager.

/ verb
1 to give information about sb/sth to an enemy 

better k /
ˈbetə(r)
/ adj., adv., noun, verb
_S adj. (comparative of good  dạng so sánh hơn của good
)
1 k of a higher standard or less poor quality; not as bad as sth else 
tốt hơn:
We’re hoping for better weather tomorrow. ◇ Her work is getting better and better. ◇ He is in a much better mood than usual. ◇ The meal couldn’t have been better. ◇ There’s nothing better than a long soak in a hot bath. ◇ If you can only exercise once a week, that’s better than nothing (= better than taking no exercise at all).
2 k more able or skilled 
giỏi hơn:
She’s far better at science than her brother.
3 k more suitable or appropriate 
thích hợp hơn:
Can you think of a better word than ‘nice’? ◇ It would be better for him to talk to his parents about his problems. ◇ You’d be better going by bus.
4 k less ill/sick or unhappy 
khá hơn (bớt đau ốm/buồn khổ):
She’s a lot better today. ◇ His leg was getting better. ◇ You’ll feel all the better for a good night’s sleep.
5 fully recovered after an illness; in good health again 
khỏi ốm; khoẻ trở lại:
Don’t go back to work until you are better.
asee also well adj.
i
Hầu hết các thành ngữ có từ better được giải thích ở các mục từ của danh từ, động từ thuộc thành ngữ đó. Ví dụ, better luck next time nằm ở mục từ luck.
little/no better than almost or just the same as; almost or just as bad as 
chẳng hơn gì:
The path was no better than a sheep track.
that’s (much) ˈbetter
1 used to give support to sb who has been upset and is trying to become calmer  dùng để an ủi người đang buồn cố bình tĩnh hơn; thế thì tốt hơn:
Dry your eyes now. That’s better.
2 used to praise sb who has made an effort to improve  dùng để ca ngợi người đã nỗ lực để cải thiện; hay/khá lắm:
That’s much better—you played the right notes this time.
the ˌbigger, ˌsmaller, ˌfaster, ˌslower, etc. the ˈbetter used to say that sth should be as big, small, etc. as possible  càng lớn/nhỏ/nhanh/chậm, vv. càng tốt:
As far as the hard disk is concerned, the bigger the better.
amore at discretion ,
head n. ,
part n. ,
prevention
_S adv. (comparative of well  dạng so sánh hơn của từ well
)
1 k in a more excellent or pleasant way; not as badly 
tốt hơn; hay hơn:
She sings much better than I do. ◇ Sound travels better in water than in air. ◇ People are better educated now.
2 k more; to a greater degree 
hơn, nhiều hơn; lớn hơn:
You’ll like her when you know her better. ◇ A cup of tea? There’s nothing I’d like better! ◇ Fit people are better able to cope with stress.
3 used to suggest that sth would be a suitable or appropriate thing to do 
hợp, thích hợp:
The money could be better spent on more urgent cases. ◇ Some things are better left unsaid. ◇ You’d do better to tell her everything before she finds out from someone else.
i
Hầu hết các thành ngữ có từ better được giải thích ở các mục từ của danh từ, tính từ, động từ thuộc thành ngữ đó. Ví dụ, better the devil you know nằm ở mục từ devil.
be better ˈoff k to have more money 
có nhiều tiền hơn:
Families will be better off under the new law. ◇ Her promotion means she’s $100 a week better off.
o
be worse off
be better off (doing sth) used to say that sb is/would be happier or more satisfied if they were in a particular position or did a particular thing  giá/nếu (làm gì đó) thì tốt hơn:
She’s better off without him. ◇ The weather was so bad we’d have been better off staying at home.
had better/best (do sth) k used to tell sb what you think they should do. 
(khuyên ai) nên:
You’d better go to the doctor about your cough. ◇ We’d better leave now or we’ll miss the bus. ◇ You’d better not do that again. ◇ ‘I’ll give you back the money tomorrow.’ ‘You’d better!’ (= as a threat)
anote at should

sing.
,

the better of the two books ◇ I expected better of him (= I thought he would have behaved better).
2 your betters [
pl.
] ( old-fashioned ) people who are more intelligent or more important than you  những người thông minh/quan trọng hơn bạn
i
for ˌbetter or (for) ˈworse used to say that sth cannot be changed, whether the result is good or bad  dù sau này hay dở thế nào (cũng không thay đổi)
get the better of sb/sth to defeat sb/sth or gain an advantage 
thắng; chiếm ưu thế:
No one can get the better of her in an argument. ◇ She always gets the better of an argument. ◇ His curiosity got the better of him (= he didn’t intend to ask questions, but he wanted to know so badly that he did).
so much the ˈbetter/ˈworse used to say that sth is even better/worse 
càng tốt hơn; càng hay hơn/càng dở hơn:
We don’t actually need it on Tuesday, but if it arrives by then, so much the better.

Thousands of Victorian workers joined educational associations in an attempt to better themselves.

between k /
bɪˈtwiːn
/ prep., adv.
_S prep.
1 k in or into the space separating two or more points, objects, people, etc 
giữa, ở giữa:
Q comes between P and R in the English alphabet. ◇ I sat down between Jo and Diana. ◇ Switzerland lies between France, Germany, Austria and Italy. ◇ The paper had fallen down between the desk and the wall. ◇ ( figurative) My job is somewhere between a secretary and a personal assistant.
2 k in the period of time that separates two days, years, events, etc 
giữa, từ...đến... (hai thời điểm, sự kiện, vv.):
It’s cheaper between 6 p.m. and 8 a.m. ◇ Don’t eat between meals. ◇ Children must attend school between the ages of 5 and 16. ◇ Many changes took place between the two world wars.
3 k at some point along a scale from one amount, weight, distance, etc. to another 
giữa, từ...đến... (hai số lượng, khối lượng, khoảng cách, vv.):
It weighed between nine and ten kilos. ◇ The temperature remained between 25 ° C and 30 ° C all week.
4 k ( of a line  đường ) separating one place from another 
giữa (ngăn cách chỗ này với chỗ kia):
the border between Sweden and Norway
5 k from one place to another 
từ...đến... (nơi chốn):
We fly between Rome and Paris twice daily.
6 k used to show a connection or relationship  dùng để chỉ mối liên hệ; giữa:
a difference/distinction/contrast between two things ◇ a link between unemployment and crime ◇ There’s a lot of bad feeling between them. ◇ I had to choose between the two jobs.
7 k shared by two or more people or things 
giữa (cùng có hai người/vật trở lên):
We ate a pizza between us. ◇ This is just between you and me/between ourselves (= it is a secret).
8 k by putting together the efforts or actions of two or more people or groups  gộp chung nỗ lực/hoạt động của hai người/nhóm người trở lên:
We ought to be able to manage it between us.
9 ~ doing sth used to show that several activities are involved 
giữa (một số hoạt động):
Between working full-time and taking care of the kids, he didn’t have much time for hobbies.
_S adv. k ( usually in between) in the space or period of time separating two or more points, objects, etc. or two dates, events, etc 
ở giữa; xen vào giữa (hai vị trí, vật thể, ngày, sự kiện, vv.):
The house was near a park but there was a road in between. ◇ I see her most weekends but not very often in between.

/ prep., adv.
_S prep.

The road continues beyond the village up into the hills.

vượt quá (muộn hơn một thời điểm nào đó):
It won’t go on beyond midnight. ◇ I know what I’ll be doing for the next three weeks but I haven’t thought beyond that.

quá cao, quá tầm:
The handle was just beyond my reach. ◇ The exercise was beyond the abilities of most of the class.

bit ,
bitten v.
i
be in ˈbits ( BrE, informal) to be very sad or worried 
buồn; lo lắng:
Inside I’m in bits because I miss him so much.
the (whole)… bit ( informal, disapproving) behaviour or ideas that are typical of a particular group, type of person or activity  cách cư xử/tư tưởng điển hình của một nhóm/loại người/hoạt động:
She couldn’t accept the whole drug-culture bit.
bit by ˈbit a piece at a time; gradually 
lần lượt; dần dần:
He assembled the model aircraft bit by bit. ◇ Bit by bit memories of the night came back to me.
a bit ˈmuch ( informal) not fair or not reasonable 
bất công; vô lý:
It’s a bit much calling me at three in the morning.
a bit of a… ( informal, especially BrE) used when talking about unpleasant or negative things or ideas, to mean ‘rather a…’  chỉ điều/ý nghĩ không hay hoặc tiêu cực:
We may have a bit of a problem on our hands. ◇ The rail strike is a bit of a pain.
a bit of all ˈright ( BrE, slang) a person that you think is sexually attractive 
người hấp dẫn
a bit of ˈrough ( BrE, slang) a person of a low social class who has a sexual relationship with sb of a higher class  người hạ lưu có quan hệ tình dục với người thượng lưu
a bit on the ˈside ( BrE, slang) the boyfriend or girlfriend of sb who is already married or in a steady sexual relationship with sb else  nhân tình
ˌbits and ˈpieces/ˈbobs ( BrE, informal) small objects or items of various kinds  đồ lặt vặt/linh tinh:
She stuffed all her bits and pieces into a bag and left.
do your ˈbit ( informal) to do your share of a task  hoàn thành phần việc của mình:
We can finish this job on time if everyone does their bit.
every bit as good, bad, etc. (as sb/sth) just as good, bad, etc; equally good, bad, etc 
cũng tốt/xấu bằng:
Rome is every bit as beautiful as Paris.
get the bit between your teeth ( informal) to become very enthusiastic about sth that you have started to do so that you are unlikely to stop until you have finished 
không kìm nén được sự phấn khích
not a ˈbit | not one (little) ˈbit not at all; not in any way 
không hề, không gì cả:
‘Are you cold?’ ‘Not a bit.’ ◇ It’s not a bit of use (= there’s no point in) complaining. ◇ I don’t like that idea one bit.
not a ˈbit of it! ( informal, BrE) used for saying that sth that you had expected to happen did not happen 
ngược lại là khác:
You’d think she’d be tired after the journey but not a bit of it!
to bits
1 into small pieces 
thành nhiều mảnh nhỏ:
The book fell to bits in my hands. ◇ She took the engine to bits, then carefully put it together again.
2 ( informal) very much 
rất nhiều, vô cùng:
I love my kids to bits. ◇ She was thrilled to bits when I said I’d come.

ˌbluff it ˈout to get out of a difficult situation by continuing to tell lies, especially when they suspect you are not being honest  thoát khỏi tình huống khó khăn bằng cách nói dối, nhất là khi bị tình nghi không trung thực
ˌbluff your way ˈin/ˈout/ˈthrough | ˌbluff your way ˈinto/ˈout of/ˈthrough sth to succeed in dealing with a difficult situation by making other people believe sth which is not true  vượt qua một tình huống khó khăn bằng cách thuyết phục người khác tin vào điều không có thật: She successfully bluffed her way through the interview.

1 k ~ to do/be sth certain or likely to happen, or to do or be sth  chắc chắn/có khả năng xảy ra, làm gì:

I
] ~ (sb/sth) to destroy sth or make sb/sth weaker; to become weak or be destroyed 
phá huỷ vật gì/làm ai bị suy yếu; suy yếu/bị phá huỷ:
to break sb’s morale/resistance/resolve/spirit ◇ The government was determined to break the power of the trade unions. ◇ The scandal broke him (= ruined his reputation and destroyed his confidence). ◇ She broke under questioning (= was no longer able to bear it) and confessed to everything.

p
ˌbreak aˈway (from sb/sth)
1 to escape suddenly from sb who is holding you or keeping you prisoner 
thoát khỏi:
The prisoner broke away from his guards.
2 to leave a political party, state, etc, especially to form a new one  ly khai (nhất là để hình thành đảng, nhà nước, vv. mới):
The people of the province wished to break away and form a new state.
arelated noun breakaway
3 to move away from a crowd or group, especially in a race  thoát ra khỏi một đám đông/nhóm, nhất là trong cuộc đua:
She broke away from the pack and opened up a two-second lead.
ˌbreak ˈdown
1 k ( of a machine or vehicle  máy móc, phương tiện đi lại ) to stop working because of a fault 
ngừng chạy vì hỏng hóc:
The telephone system has broken down. ◇ We (= the car) broke down on the freeway.
arelated noun breakdown
2 k to fail 
thất bại:
Negotiations between the two sides have broken down.
arelated noun breakdown
3 to become very bad 
trở nặng, xấu:
Her health broke down under the pressure of work.
asee also nervous breakdown
4 k to lose control of your feelings and start crying 
nức nở:
He broke down and wept when he heard the news.
5 to divide into parts to be analysed 
chia nhỏ:
Expenditure on the project breaks down as follows: wages $10m, plant $4m, raw materials $5m.
arelated noun breakdown
alanguage bank at illustrate
ˌbreak sth↔ˈdown
1 k to make sth fall down, open, etc. by hitting it hard 
phá vỡ, đạp đổ, xô đổ:
Firefighters had to break the door down to reach the people trapped inside.
2 to destroy sth or make it disappear, especially a particular feeling or attitude that sb has 
xoá bỏ; xua đuổi (cảm giác, thái độ):
to break down resistance/opposition ◇ to break down sb’s reserve/shyness ◇ Attempts must be made to break down the barriers of fear and hostility which divide the two communities.
3 to divide sth into parts in order to analyse it or make it easier to do  chia nhỏ để phân tích hoặc để dễ làm:
Break your expenditure down into bills, food and other. ◇ Each lesson is broken down into several units.
arelated noun breakdown
4 to make a substance separate into parts or change into a different form in a chemical process  tách chất/làm biến đổi một chất trong quá trình hoá học:
Sugar and starch are broken down in the stomach.
arelated noun breakdown
ˈbreak for sth to suddenly run towards sth when you are trying to escape 
chạy thoát về hướng:
She had to hold him back as he tried to break for the door.
ˌbreak ˈin k to enter a building by force 
đột nhập (bằng cách phá cửa, bẻ khoá):
Burglars had broken in while we were away.
arelated noun break-in
ˌbreak sb/sth ˈin
1 to train sb/sth in sth new that they must do  huấn luyện người nào/cái gì về một việc mới họ phải làm:
to break in new recruits ◇ The young horse was not yet broken in (= trained to carry a rider).
2 to wear sth, especially new shoes, until they become comfortable  đi giày mới đến khi thấy dễ chịu
ˌbreak ˈin (on sth) to interrupt or disturb sth 
xen ngang; làm phiền, quấy rầy:
She longed to break in on their conversation but didn’t want to appear rude. ◇ + speech ‘I didn’t do it!’ she broke in.
ˌbreak ˈinto sth
1 k to enter a building by force; to open a car, etc. by force 
đột nhập vào nhà/ô tô (bằng cách phá cửa, bẻ khoá):
We had our car broken into last week.
arelated noun break-in
2 to begin laughing, singing, etc. suddenly 
phá lên, bật lên, cất lên (tiếng cười, tiếng hát, vv.):
As the President’s car drew up, the crowd broke into loud applause.
3 to suddenly start running; to start running faster than before 
bỏ chạy:
He broke into a run when he saw the police. ◇ Her horse broke into a trot.
4 ( BrE) to use a banknote of high value to buy sth that costs less  dùng tiền có mệnh giá to để mua vật có giá trị thấp:
I had to break into a £20 note to pay the bus fare.
5 to open and use sth that has been kept for an emergency  mở và sử dụng khi khẩn cấp:
They had to break into the emergency food supplies.
6 to be successful when you get involved in sth  thành công khi tham gia vào việc gì:
The company is having difficulty breaking into new markets.
ˌbreak ˈoff
1 k to become separated from sth as a result of force 
bị gãy/vỡ:
The back section of the plane had broken off.
2 to stop speaking or stop doing sth for a time  ngừng nói/làm việc gì một thời gian:
He broke off in the middle of a sentence.
ˌbreak sth↔ˈoff k
1 to separate sth, using force 
bẻ:
She broke off a piece of chocolate and gave it to me.
2 k to end sth suddenly 
kết thúc đột ngột:
Britain threatened to break off diplomatic relations. ◇ They’ve broken off their engagement.
ˌbreak ˈout k ( of war, fighting or other unpleasant events  chiến tranh, các cuộc chiến đấu hoặc những sự kiện không hay khác ) to start suddenly 
đột ngột xảy ra; bùng nổ, nổ ra:
They had escaped to America shortly before war broke out in 1939. ◇ Fighting had broken out between rival groups of fans. ◇ Fire broke out during the night.
arelated noun outbreak
ˌbreak ˈout (of sth) to escape from a place or situation 
trốn thoát, thoát khỏi (nơi chốn, tình huống):
Several prisoners broke out of the jail. ◇ She needed to break out of her daily routine and do something exciting.
arelated noun breakout
ˌbreak ˈout in sth to suddenly become covered in sth  đột nhiên bị phủ đầy thứ gì đó:
Her face broke out in a rash. ◇ He broke out in a cold sweat (= for example, through fear).
ˌbreak ˈthrough to make new and important discoveries  có những phát hiện mới và quan trọng:
Scientists think they are beginning to break through in the fight against cancer.
arelated noun breakthrough
ˌbreak ˈthrough | ˌbreak ˈthrough sth
1 to make a way through sth using force 
phá vỡ:
Demonstrators broke through the police cordon.
2 ( of the sun or moon  mặt trời, mặt trăng ) to appear from behind clouds 
ló ra, hiện ra (từ sau đám mây):
The sun broke through at last in the afternoon.
ˌbreak ˈthrough sth to succeed in dealing with an attitude that sb has and the difficulties it creates 
vượt qua (khó khăn)
s
overcome
: He had finally managed to break through her reserve.
ˌbreak ˈup
1 k to separate into smaller pieces  phân/tách ra nhiều mảnh:
The ship broke up on the rocks.
2 k to come to an end 
kết thúc:
Their marriage has broken up.
arelated noun break-up
3 to go away in different directions 
giải tán:
The meeting broke up at eleven o’clock.
4 ( especially BrE) to begin the holidays when school closes at the end of a term 
nghỉ hè:
When do you break up for Christmas?
5 ( BrE) to become very weak 
suy yếu đi:
He was breaking up under the strain.
6 ( NAmE) to laugh very hard 
cười rất to:
Woody Allen makes me just break up.
7 when a person who is talking on a mobile/cell phone breaks up, you can no longer hear them clearly because the signal has been interrupted  không còn nghe rõ vì tín hiệu điện thoại bị gián đoạn
ˌbreak sth↔ˈup
1 k to make sth separate into smaller pieces; to divide sth into smaller parts 
chia/phân nhỏ:
The ship was broken up for scrap metal. ◇ Sentences can be broken up into clauses.
2 to end a relationship, a company, etc 
chấm dứt, kết thúc:
They decided to break up the partnership.
arelated noun break-up
3 to make people leave sth or stop doing sth, especially by using force  buộc ai từ bỏ cái gì hoặc ngưng làm việc gì, nhất là bằng vũ lực:
Police were called in to break up the fight.
ˌbreak ˈup (with sb) k to end a relationship with sb 
chia tay, chấm dứt quan hệ:
She’s just broken up with her boyfriend.
arelated noun break-up

đoạn tuyệt:
to break with tradition/old habits/the past

ˌbring sth↔ˈdown
1 kto reduce sth 
giảm, giảm bớt:
We aim to bring down prices on all our computers.
2 to land an aircraft 
hạ cánh:
The pilot managed to bring the plane down in a field.
3 to make an aircraft fall out of the sky 
làm rơi máy bay:
Twelve enemy fighters had been brought down.
4 to make an animal or a bird fall down or fall out of the sky by killing or wounding it 
bắn rơi:
He brought down the bear with a single shot.
ˌbring sb/sth↔ˈforth ( old use or formal) to give birth to sb; to produce sth 
sinh ra; sản xuất ra:

ˌbring sth↔ˈforward
1 kto move sth to an earlier date or time 
dời, chuyển thời gian/thời điểm (về trước):
The meeting has been brought forward from 10 May to 3 May.
2 to suggest sth for discussion 
đưa ra thảo luận:
Please bring the matter forward at the next meeting.
3 to move a total sum from the bottom of one page or column of numbers to the top of the next 
chuyển khoản:
A credit balance of $50 was brought forward from his September account.
ˌbring sb↔ˈin
1 to ask sb to do a particular job or to be involved in sth  yêu cầu ai làm/tham gia vào việc gì:
Local residents were angry at not being brought in on (= asked for their opinion about) the new housing proposal. ◇ ~ to do sth Experts were brought in to advise the government.
2 ( of the police  cảnh sát ) to bring sb to a police station in order to ask them questions or arrest them 

Two men were brought in for questioning.

ban hành luật:
They want to bring in a bill to limit arms exports.

lôi cuốn, hấp dẫn:
We need to bring in a lot more new business.

The jury brought in a verdict of guilty.

ˈbring sth on yourself/sb to be responsible for sth unpleasant that happens to you/sb  chịu trách nhiệm về điều không hay xảy đến cho bạn hoặc người nào:

ˌbring sth↔ˈout
1 kto make sth appear 
làm cái gì xuất hiện; đem lại, mang lại:
A crisis brings out the best in her.
2 to make sth easy to see or understand 

That dress really brings out the colour of your eyes.

The band have just brought out their second album.

ˌburn ˈout | ˌburn yourself/sb ˈout to become extremely tired or sick by working too hard over a period of time  kiệt sức vì làm việc quá nhiều trong thời gian dài:

bɜːst; NAmE bɜːrst
/ verb, noun
_S verb k(
burst, burst
)
1 k [
I ,
T
] to break open or apart, especially because of pressure from inside; to make sth break in this way 
(làm) nổ tung:
That balloon will burst if you blow it up any more. ◇ The dam burst under the weight of water. ◇ Shells were bursting (= exploding) all around us. ◇ ( figurative) He felt he would burst with anger and shame. ◇ a burst pipe ◇ ~ sth Don’t burst that balloon! ◇ The river burst its banks and flooded nearby towns.
asynonyms at explode
2 k [
I
] + adv./prep. to go or move somewhere suddenly with great force; to come from somewhere suddenly 
bật lên; nổ ra:
He burst into the room without knocking. ◇ The sun burst through the clouds. ◇ The words burst from her in an angry rush.
3 [
I
] be bursting (with sth) to be very full of sth; to be very full and almost breaking open 
đầy ắp, đầy căng:
The roads are bursting with cars. ◇ to be bursting with ideas/enthusiasm/pride ◇ The hall was filled to bursting point. ◇ The hall was full to bursting. ◇ ( informal) I’m bursting (for a pee)! (= I need to use the toilet right now).
i
be bursting to do sth to want to do sth so much that you can hardly stop yourself 
nóng lòng, háo hức:
She was bursting to tell him the good news.
ˌburst sb’s ˈbubble to bring an end to sb’s hopes, happiness, etc.  chấm dứt hy vọng, niềm hạnh phúc của người khác, vv.
ˌburst ˈopen | ˌburst (sth) ˈopen to open suddenly or violently; to make sth open in this way 
(làm) nổ tung/vỡ tung:
The door burst open. ◇ Firefighters burst the door open and rescued them.
amore at bubble n. ,
seam
p
ˌburst ˈin | ˌburst into a ˈroom, ˈbuilding, etc. to enter a room or building suddenly and noisily 
xông/xộc vào phòng
ˌburst ˈin on sb/sth to interrupt sb/sth by entering a place suddenly and noisily  ngắt lời/làm gián đoạn việc gì bằng cách xông vào nơi nào:
He burst in on the meeting.
ˈburst into sth k to start producing sth suddenly and with great force 
bùng lên, bật lên:
The aircraft crashed and burst into flames (= suddenly began to burn). ◇ She burst into tears (= suddenly began to cry).
ˈburst on/onto sth to appear somewhere suddenly in a way that is very noticeable 
thình lình xuất hiện/hiện ra (gây chú ý):
A major new talent has burst onto the literary scene.
ˌburst ˈout
1 to speak suddenly, loudly and with strong feeling 
thốt lên (với cảm xúc mạnh):
+ speech ‘For heavens’ sake!’ he burst out.
arelated noun outburst
asynonyms at call
2 kto begin doing sth suddenly 
bất chợt làm gì:
~ doing sth Karen burst out laughing.
_S noun
1 a short period of a particular activity or strong emotion that often starts suddenly 
sự bùng nổ (hoạt động, tình cảm):
a sudden burst of activity/energy/anger/enthusiasm ◇ Her breath was coming in short bursts. ◇ I tend to work in bursts. ◇ spontaneous bursts of applause
2 an occasion when sth bursts; the hole left where sth has burst 
sự nổ tung; lỗ/hố tạo ra sau khi vật gì nổ:
a burst in a water pipe
3 a short series of shots from a gun 
loạt súng (trong thời gian ngắn):
frequent bursts of machine-gun fire

xảy ra đều đặn (trong thời gian ngắn)

bury
bury k /
ˈberi
/ verb (
bur•ies, bury•ing, bur•ied, bur•ied
)
b dead person
1 k ~ sb/sth to place a dead body in a grave 
chôn cất:
He was buried in Highgate Cemetery. ◇ ( figurative) Their ambitions were finally dead and buried.
2 ~ sb ( old-fashioned ) to lose sb by death 
mất người thân:
She’s 85 and has buried three husbands.
b hide in ground
3 k ~ sth to hide sth in the ground 
chôn giấu:
buried treasure ◇ The dog had buried its bone in the garden.
b cover
4 k [
often passive
] to cover sb/sth with soil, rocks, leaves, etc 
che phủ (bằng đất, đá, lá cây, vv.):
~ sb/sth The house was buried under ten feet of snow. ◇ ~ sb/sth + adj. The miners were buried alive when the tunnel collapsed.
5 k ~ sth to cover sth so that it cannot be seen 
che giấu:
Your letter got buried under a pile of papers. ◇ He buried his face in his hands and wept.
b hide feeling
6 ~ sth to ignore or hide a feeling, a mistake, etc 
phớt lờ; che giấu (cảm xúc, lỗi lầm, vv.):
She had learnt to bury her feelings.
b put deeply into sth
7 ~ sth (in sth) to put sth deeply into sth else 
nhét/đút sâu:
He walked slowly, his hands buried in his pockets. ◇ She always has her head buried in a book.
i

giảng hoà
amore at head n.

ˈbury yourself in sth
1 to give all your attention to sth 
tập trung toàn bộ tâm trí:
Since she left, he’s buried himself in his work.
2 to go to or be in a place where you will not meet many people  chôn vùi cuộc đời vào việc gì:
She buried herself in the country to write a book.

commerce

U
] work that is part of your job 

3 k [
U
] the amount of work done by a company, etc; the rate or quality of this work 

C
] a commercial organization such as a company, shop/store or factory 

5 k [
U
] something that concerns a particular person or organization 

U
] important matters that need to be dealt with or discussed  vấn đề quan trọng cần giải quyết/thảo luận:

b event
7 [
sing.
] (usually with an adjective  thường dùng với tính từ ) a matter, an event or a situation 
vấn đề; sự kiện; tình huống:

i
any other ˈbusiness the things that are discussed at the end of an official meeting that do not appear on the agenda  việc không nằm trong chương trình nghị sự và được thảo luận vào cuối buổi họp:

asee also
AOB
be in ˈbusiness ( informal) to have everything that you need in order to be able to start sth immediately  có mọi thứ cần thiết để có thể bắt đầu làm việc gì ngay:

be the ˈbusiness ( informal) to be very good 
rất tốt

ˌbusiness is ˈbusiness a way of saying that financial and commercial matters are the important things to consider and you should not be influenced by friendship, etc. 
công việc là công việc (không nên để tình cảm bạn bè, vv. ảnh hưởng)
get down to ˈbusiness to start dealing with the matter that needs to be dealt with, or doing the work that needs to be done 
bắt tay vào việc
go about your ˈbusiness to do the things that you normally do 
làm công việc thường làm:

have no business doing sth | have no business to do sth to have no right to do sth 
không có quyền làm:
You have no business being here.
like ˈnobody’s business ( BrE, informal) very much, very fast, very well, etc 
rất nhiều; rất nhanh; rất tốt:
I’ve been working like nobody’s business to get it finished in time.
not be in the business of doing sth not intending to do sth (which it would be surprising for you to do) 
không có ý định làm điều gì (khiến người khác ngạc nhiên):
I’m not in the business of getting other people to do my work for me.
out of ˈbusiness having stopped operating as a business because there is no more money or work available 
vỡ nợ, phá sản:
The new regulations will put many small businesses out of business. ◇ Some travel companies will probably go out of business this summer.

_S conj.
1 k used to introduce a word or phrase that contrasts with what was said before 

5 except 
trừ, ngoại trừ:

6 used before repeating a word in order to emphasize it  dùng trước khi lặp lại một từ để nhấn mạnh:

7 ( literary) used to emphasize that sth is always true  dùng để nhấn mạnh điều luôn đúng:

by
by k /
baɪ
/ prep., adv.
_S prep.
1 knear sb/sth; at the side of sb/sth; beside sb/sth 
gần; bên cạnh; kế:
a house by the river ◇ The telephone is by the window. ◇ Come and sit by me.
2 k used, usually after a passive verb, to show who or what does, creates or causes sth  thường dùng sau động từ ở dạng bị động để cho biết chủ thể hành động:
He was knocked down by a bus. ◇ a play by Ibsen ◇ Who’s that book by? ◇ I was frightened by the noise.
3 k used for showing how or in what way sth is done  dùng để thể hiện cách thức thực hiện:
The house is heated by gas. ◇ May I pay by cheque? ◇ I will contact you by letter. ◇ to travel by boat/bus/car/plane ◇ to travel by air/land/sea ◇ Switch it on by pressing this button.
4 k used before particular nouns without the, to say that sth happens as a result of sth  (dùng trước danh từ) do, vì, bởi:
They met by chance. ◇ I did it by mistake. ◇ The coroner’s verdict was ‘death by misadventure’.
5 knot later than the time mentioned; before 
vào lúc; trước:
Can you finish the work by five o’clock? ◇ I’ll have it done by tomorrow. ◇ By this time next week we’ll be in New York. ◇ He ought to have arrived by now/by this time. ◇ By the time (that) this letter reaches you I will have left the country.
6 kpast sb/sth 
ngang qua:
He walked by me without speaking.
7 kduring sth; in a particular situation 
trong khi; trong hoàn cảnh:
to travel by day/night ◇ We had to work by candlelight.
8 k used to show the degree or amount of sth  dùng để thể hiện mức độ/số lượng:
The bullet missed him by two inches. ◇ House prices went up by 10%. ◇ It would be better by far (= much better) to…
9 kfrom what sth shows or says; according to sth 
theo như:
By my watch it is two o’clock. ◇ I could tell by the look on her face that something terrible had happened. ◇ By law, you are a child until you are 18.
10 k used to show the part of sb/sth that sb touches, holds, etc.  dùng để chỉ bộ phận được chạm đến, giữ, vv.:
I took him by the hand. ◇ She seized her by the hair. ◇ Pick it up by the handle!
11 k used with the to show the period or quantity used for buying, selling or measuring sth  dùng để chỉ khoảng thời gian/số lượng mua, bán, đo đạc:
We rented the car by the day. ◇ They’re paid by the hour. ◇ We only sell it by the metre.
12 k used to state the rate at which sth happens  dùng để chỉ tốc độ xảy ra:
They’re improving day by day. ◇ We’ll do it bit by bit. ◇ It was getting worse by the minute (= very fast). ◇ The children came in two by two (= in groups of two).
13 k used to show the measurements of sth  dùng để chỉ số đo:
The room measures fifteen feet by twenty feet.
14 k used when multiplying or dividing  dùng khi nhân/chia:
6 multiplied by 2 equals 12. ◇ 6 divided by 2 equals 3.
15 used for giving more information about where sb comes from, what sb does, etc.  dùng khi cung cấp thêm thông tin về nơi ở, việc làm, vv. của người khác:
He’s German by birth. ◇ They’re both doctors by profession.
16 used when swearing to mean ‘in the name of’ 
nhân danh (dùng khi thề thốt/tuyên thệ):
I swear by Almighty God…
